data.title: Forest / Terrain weirdness
data.body:
Hi the full details are here: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/134883

Essentials strange performance when moving forwards or backwards but not when turning left or right - caused by a 2mb forest and resolved when I remove it (much larger forests have worked fine on other maps)

data.title: RenderMeshExample won't render transparent materials properly
data.body: This commit will fix it. Spent some time figuring out how to render transparent objects, this will make it more clear for other newcomers.

data.title: Deleting GUIContainer does not delete child objects
data.body: Title describes it perfectly, deleting a GUIContainer does not delete all of it's child objects. Repeating is simple, go into the GUI Editor, create a new GUIContainer add an object to it and assign it a name, delete the container and try to create a new control using the same child object name, get existing object error, complain as you need to open the console to delete it... Rinse, wash, repeat, ect.

data.title: Gamepad and joystick dead zone calculation incorrect
Export to collada bug
data.body:
Exported collada object from torque3d editor fails to load in blender.

The reason seems to be the format:
under 3d max the file is imported correctly if Autodesk collada is selected.

data.title: Added default parameter to GuiMLTextCtrl::addText
data.body:
The `reformat` parameter now defaults to `true`, so the function can be called like:

```
BottomPrintText.addText(" more words");
```

and the control will update, which seems reasonable.

data.title: Fix bug in HTTPObject (Fixed)

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
Fixed the pull request.

HTTPObject's processLine function's signature did not match the virtual processLine function on TCPObject. This caused undesired results.

Instead of HTTPObject::onLine containing just the response data, it also included the full HTTP header. I assume this was not the intended functionality because HTTPObject's processLine was never getting called and fixing it gave me the output that I expected from an HTTP helper class.

There is also an issue where the data returned from the server requires a new line appended to the end, but that problem is happening in TCPObject.

Another issue is that HTTPObject seems to leave the socket connection open after receiving the response from the server. I had to add special code to my php file to force the connection closed.

Anyway, this only fixes the first problem.

data.title: QuerySingleServer Problem (Fixed)
data.body:
I fixed the pull request.

Work around for Issue #418

data.title: Fix bug in HTTPObject
data.body:
HTTPObject's processLine function's signature did not match the virtual processLine function on TCPObject. This caused undesired results.

Instead of HTTPObject::onLine containing just the response data, it also included the full HTTP header. I assume this was not the intended functionality because HTTPObject's processLine was never getting called and fixing it gave me the output that I expected from an HTTP helper class.

There is also an issue where the data returned from the server requires a new line appended to the end, but that problem is happening in TCPObject.

Another issue is that HTTPObject seems to leave the socket connection open after receiving the response from the server. I had to add special code to my php file to force the connection closed.

data.title: Enable DirectX 9Ex
AIPlayer path node slowdown
data.body:
Updates AIPlayer script class to account for looping paths and slows the aiplayer down on the last node if it's not a looping path.

References issue #60

To check the fix.. Setup a path w/ pathnodes and spawn an ai player to that path, following that path. I used 7 nodes in a circular formation so I could ensure that when I selected checked the isLooping flag on the path in the editor, that the ai would pay attention. Once your ai is following the path you'll notice they do slow down at each of those nodes in the path. Make sure to save your level. Then apply the fix and reload your game and test level. Respawn the ai on the path again and watch them follow the path, but notice they don't slow down anymore at each node. If is looping is checked the ai will not slow down at any of the nodes. Now uncheck islooping on the path so it won't loop and do this before you ai reaches the second to last node. Notice now, that the ai will slow down while approaching the last node in that path. If you recheck islooping on the path, the ai will just resume following the path and continue from it's position.

data.title: Heap corruption caused by incorrect Torque Script naming
data.body: Adds a check to make sure a dynamic variable won't be named the same as a ts class name. The change to the original solution is that the object is rejected instead of being renamed. References Issue #84 Credit to Tim Newell

data.title: Platform type consistency

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body: Update to make platform/types.h basic types F32, F64 S32, U32, etc consistent in the engine. This is also in reference to issue #85. I'm aware this may be one of the last merged, if at all.

data.title: Improve float / double consistency with platform types F32 and F64
data.body: Updates to set consistency in platform type usage. Changed float to F32 and double to F64. Reference to Issue #85

data.title: Bug in TSShapeInstance::MaskNodeHandsOff
data.body: When using TSShapeInstance::MaskNodeHandsOff to manually control a nodes rotation and position, you will get garbage data which will cause weird popping specially when switching animations. Credit to Tim Newell, References bug #83

data.title: Expose ShapeBase blowUp method
data.body: This means it can be called from scripts on objects like Player that don't usually blow up. [Credit to Michael Hall.](http://www.garagegames.com/community/resources/view/21682)

data.title: stream->read(ColorF*) is not working
data.body:
In packData I have:

``` c++
stream->write(mColorVariance);
```

Where mColorVariance is a ColorF.

In unpackData

``` c++
stream->read(mColorVariance);
```

Seems to try and read it as a F32 and as a result only the red channel gets changed, and it's just getting corrupted.

Doing this however:

``` c++
ColorI ColVarBuffer;
stream->read(&ColVarBuffer);
mColorVariance = ColVarBuffer;
```

Works fine.

data.title: Replacement of turbulence PostFX improves visual quality of underwater scenes
data.body: Simple replacement of the turbulence postfx and to improve the overall visual quality of the effect. This is a completely different effect than the original.

data.title: UUID Replacement
data.body: As documented in issue #448, the definition of "using namespace Torque;" in a header file can cause some conflicting issues between the Windows rpcde "::UUID" declaration and T3D's "Torque::UUID" declaration. This pull request removes the namespace declaration from the header file and instead adds the declaration to the source code files in the engine that require the namespace declaration.

data.title: Redefinition of ::UUID
data.body:
I think it would be beneficial to check over how Torque::UUID is being defined as some of my addons are having some issues compiling stating that ::UUID (a default class) is being interfered with.

I propose making the changes noted here: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/114057/1#comment-741761 

Part of the default engine build. I would pull request this, but my copy is currently so messed up so it would take so much more time to re-do it than someone with much more git experience than myself.

data.title: Increase terrain editing and painting brush max sizes
data.body:
Increase terrain editing and painting brush max sizes from 40 x 40 to 256 x 256.

Both empty and full templates have been changed.

data.title: Increase terrain editing and painting brush max sizes
data.body:
Increase terrain editing and painting brush max sizes from 40 x 40 to 256 x 256.

Both empty and full templates have been changed.

data.title: Increased terrain brushes for painting and editing
data.body: Increased terrain brushes for painting and editing to 256 x 256 from 40 x 40, both templates have also been changed

data.title: Replaced entire projectGenerator with cMake system
data.body:
This is replacement for generating compile solution for Torque3D on Windows x86. Currently system is supporting only Win x86, but I will soon update code with additional support for Unix. Also I would like to say that I am not owner of Mac so I cannot update cMake system for full Mac support.

I have increased minimum required version of cMake (to 2.8.11) because of possibility to generate new Visual Studio 2013 Preview solutions. On my initial testing and using whole cMake system was working OK without big problems. 

If there are problems please say so I can fix this.

EDIT:
I have included new version of Bullet library. Reasons for that was because I had enormous problems with old build and getting cMake to work nicely with T3D and Bullet.
Personally I don't believe that this should be really big problem with integrating cMake and Bullet in one pull request. But its possible that I am wrong.

data.title: Fixed DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) inside T3D engine
data.body:
Fixed DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) inside T3D engine.
Little more info, I have moved queryPropertyDXGI after queryPropertyDxDiag, personally I don't believe that we could get better information about GPU if we query DXGI.
